intro: Baccharis schlechtendalii, commonly known as Schlechtendal's baccharis, is a shrub native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties. Its compact growth habit and ornamental value make it a popular choice for landscaping in arid regions.
